meanings.definition: A large number of people or things.
meanings.sent1: During the parade, multitudes of spectators lined the streets.
meanings.sent2: There were multitudes of colorful flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The multitudes of toys in the store made the children's eyes widen in amazement.
meanings.sent4: The multitudes of stars in the night sky twinkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The multitudes of books in the library seemed to stretch on forever.

meanings.sent1: She had multitudes of homework to finish before the weekend.
meanings.sent2: There were multitudes of birds chirping in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The multitudes of cookies on the plate tempted him to have just one more.
meanings.sent4: The multitudes of raindrops falling created a soothing sound on the roof.
meanings.sent5: The multitudes of colors in the painting blended harmoniously together.
